definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: Weddings and funerals are the emotional events.
sentences.chinese: 婚事和丧事都是动感情的时候。

sentences.english: When Michele offered to help with the funeral arrangements, Dave could not thank her enough.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔主动提出帮助安排丧事，戴维感激得不得了。

sentences.english: Hou mother decided mourning together happy do not bribe, and inspector put gold father.
sentences.chinese: 侯母决定丧事喜事一起办，并买通巡长暂不放金父。

sentences.english: And she would be hired to wail at every funeral.
sentences.chinese: 谁家再有丧事，必请你银娇奶奶帮哭。

sentences.english: That will make two funerals under the same carriage gate.
sentences.chinese: 大门堂下将会有两起丧事。

sentences.english: He is the Master of Mourning.
That only pays a few dollars per day.
sentences.chinese: 丧事唱一天，一个人才分几十块钱。

sentences.english: If there was a funeral, people from neighboring villages would come to watch her cry.
sentences.chinese: 谁家办丧事，方圆十里地都有人赶来看她哭。

sentences.english: A funeral would have a lot of onlookers from morning to night.
sentences.chinese: 办丧事那天，从早到晚的，都有很多人来看。

definition: to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent
to visit the bereaved to offer one's condolences
to keep watch beside a coffin
to announce sb's demise/to predict death
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻帶孝|披麻带孝
